intro: Stenogyne bracteosa, commonly known as the bracteosa mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Stenogyne bracteosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
